result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rocky Allen Butler

defendant.name: Butler, Rocky Allen
defendant.address: 6865 N South Reserve Rd, Stone Lake, WI 54876

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:07 AM Defendant Rocky Allen Butler in court.  Attorney Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt appears in court.   Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Through Attorney, DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court sets bond.  SIBS $2500   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.   DEF to report to jail for fingerprints.
Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on January 6, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

OFF RECORD / 3:08 PM Defendant Rocky Allen Butler in court.  Attorney Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) for Rocky Allen Butler. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Pollak requests for a reset on cases. Court resets hearings.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
10:01 AM Defendant Rocky Allen Butler not in court.  No appearances for the State.  Court calls case and makes record.  Warrant quashed.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
